channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 20-year election official debunks ‘dangerous myths’ about the U.S. electoral process
item.description: Myths about fraud and abuse may grab headlines but don’t represent reality. The U.S. electoral system is among the safest and most secure in the world...

item.title: Worker in Netanyahu Office Accused of Leaking Classified Documents in Israel: What to Know
item.description: An individual with connections to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s office is being investigated. Here’s what to know about how the furor began and ...

item.title: Inside ‘returnless refunds,’ where you can get your money back and keep what you bought—a mysterious process many retailers don’t publicize
item.description: Companies like Amazon, Walmart, Target, Shein and Temu understand some items are not worth the cost or hassle of getting them back.

item.title: On the Move with ‘Subway Takes’ Creator Kareem Rahma
item.description: The creator and host of “Subway Takes” and “Keep the Meter Running” makes New Yorkers — and the Democratic presidential ticket — explain themselves.

item.title: Right-Wing Groups Are Organizing on Telegram Ahead of Election Day
item.description: Right-wing groups, which use Telegram to organize real-world actions, are urging followers to watch the polls and stand up for their rights, in a harb...

item.title: Chronic Diseases Can Come With Chronic Financial Pressure
item.description: For millions of Americans, paying for the treatment needed to manage their diseases can become its own lifelong problem.

item.title: Smog Will Shut Schools in Pakistan’s 2nd-Largest City for a Week
item.description: The city of Lahore reported hazardous levels of air pollution on Sunday. Pakistani officials have blamed India for some of it.

item.title: Heavy Rains Hit Spain, Still Reeling From Deadly Flooding
item.description: Emergency workers continued to search for victims of last week’s flash floods, while a national debate raged over who was to blame for the catastrophe...

item.title: Blocked users on Elon Musk’s X can once again see your posts
item.description: They cannot, however, interact with them.

item.title: Heavy Rains Hit Spain, Still Reeling From Deadly Flooding
item.description: Emergency workers continued to search for victims of last week’s flash floods, while a national debate raged over who was to blame for the catastrophe...

item.title: In Northern Gaza, Staying and Evacuation Both Carry Deadly Risks
item.description: For Gazans facing Israel’s latest offensive against Hamas in the north, every option is fraught with peril.

item.title: Trump v Harris election vote leaves corporate America facing $250 billion tax swing
item.description: The difference between Trump's proposed tax policies and those of his opponent, Kamala Harris, amount to a potential 12% swing in corporate net profit...

item.title: Quincy Jones: A Life in Photos
item.description: Mr. Jones’s extraordinary musical talent was perhaps matched only by his work ethic, making him one of the most prolific people in music.

item.title: Pro-West Leader Wins High-Stakes Vote in Former Soviet Republic
item.description: The president of Moldova, Maia Sandu, won re-election on Sunday against a rival candidate she had denounced as “Moscow’s man.”

item.title: More Millennials and Gen Xers are getting colorectal cancer. Even young adults should watch for these 7 symptoms
item.description: Millennials are at twice the risk for colorectal cancer compared to Baby Boomers.
